str2: If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To pain, grieve, vex. From lupe; to distress; reflexively or passively, to be sad.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A letter, dispatch, epistle, message. From epistello; a written message.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: From meta and the middle voice of melo; to care afterwards, i.e. Regret.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: From meta and the middle voice of melo; to care afterwards, i.e. Regret.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: (primarily physical), I look, see, perceive, discern. A primary verb; to look at.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A letter, dispatch, epistle, message. From epistello; a written message.
That, that one there, yonder. From ekei; that one (neuter) thing); often intensified by the article prefixed.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To pain, grieve, vex. From lupe; to distress; reflexively or passively, to be sad.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
